title: Hot air and Katie Hopkins: remember when The Apprentice was the business?
text:
In January 2005, George W Bush had just entered his second term in office, Kim Kardashian was working as Paris Hilton’s wardrobe assistant, and Steve Brookstein - The X Factor's first superstar-in-waiting (ahem) - was number one. And on the BBC, Lord Alan Sugar launched The Apprentice, a British version of the smash-hit US reality series hosted by Donald Trump.

But while that show is long dead, its star currently the leader of the free world, our Apprentice is still alive and kicking and this week beginning its 15th series. And barring a few new faces, absolutely nothing about it has changed.

The Apprentice has often, of course, been completely brilliant. Even today it exists as a reliably funny...
